intro: Sabatia heterophyla, commonly known as the variable sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as fields and dunes. It has alternate, linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Sabatia heterophyla is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to coastal and inland environments.
